content.rendered:
What would your rather have?

A million dollars?
Free food for life?

A trip to Hawaii?
A trip to the country?

A free pass to any more for the rest of your life?
The ability to read any book in seconds?

A new car every year for the rest of your life?
A car that never needed repairs?

A personal chef for life?
A personal trainer for life?
The man or woman of your dreams?
To be the man or woman of someone else’s dreams?

A relationship with someone whom you think the be the most beautiful or most handsome?
A relationship of service and commitment to the other?

You might think that the last one is a trick question, but true, lasting relationships, thought they may begin with physical attraction, won’t last long if that’s all there is. That’s why so many relationships don’t last. A lasting relationship needs a commitment to the other person that goes deeper and seeks to serve and love the other.

“Love is patient, love is kind. It does not envy, it does not boast, it is not proud. It does not dishonor others, it is not self-seeking, it is not easily angered, it keeps no record of wrongs. Love does not delight in evil but rejoices with the truth. It always protects, always trusts, always hopes, always perseveres.” — 1 Corinthians 13:4-7 (NIV)

There’s nothing in that verse that talks about getting our own way or having things be perfect. In fact, if we keep looking for perfection, we will never find it. But if we seek to serve, whether it be others, or the God who created us, we will become more loving. And, as 1 Corinthians tells us, there is nothing is more important that we can do than love others.
